thread.title: Could Al Golden be in Rutgers future?
thread.title_full: Could Al Golden be in Rutgers future?

author: app.com
title: Could Al Golden be in Rutgers future?
text:
MORE The Rutgers connections are everywhere when you look at the fallout from Miami’s firing of head coach Al Golden, a Colts Neck native, on Sunday.
And those tie-ins could trace all the way to Piscataway in the coming weeks, depending on how things play out for embattled Rutgers head coach Kyle Flood.
Because Golden, with strong New Jersey ties and a history of rebuilding programs, would have to be considered a strong candidate if Rutgers decides to make a change.
In letting Golden go with four years remaining on his contract after the Hurricanes disastrous 58-0 loss to Clemson, the coaching search in South Florida will center around two coaches with strong ties to the Scarlet Knights.
At the top of the list of candidates to replace Golden is former Rutgers head coach Greg Schiano, who brought the Scarlet Knights back to the national spotlight during his 11 seasons in Piscataway.
Schiano, who left Rutgers for the Tampa Bay Bucs in 2012, was Miami’s defensive coordinator for two seasons (1999-00) before coming to Rutgers.
